MajorClaims.Text: every fast and not well thought decision is a wasted one
a hurried decision is almost never a good one

Claims.Text: making quick decisions leads to probable bad results
making a rushed decision could also mean that the person is missing out on a potential opportunity
hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person

Premises.Text: making a quick decision means that it's not very thought out, and that it hasn't been checked from all its aspects
if someone decided to quit his job without really thinking about the alternative, or a plan B, he could end up being unemployed, because of his speedy decision
if this person had waited and thought his decision through he wouldn't have missed out on the job opening in the same firm, but at a different position
To put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs
his life had taken a turn to the worst
